holidays.name: Make a Friend Day
holidays.description: A perfect day to reach out and make a new friend. Whether in person or online, it's all about kindness and connection!
holidays.origin: The exact origin is unclear, but it‚Äôs celebrated as a way to promote social connection and goodwill.
holidays.funFact: Studies show making new friends can boost happiness and mental health, so today‚Äôs holiday is scientifically proven to be good for you!

holidays.name: National Don‚Äôt Cry Over Spilled Milk Day
holidays.description: An unofficial day reminding us not to sweat the small stuff, especially when things go wrong!
holidays.origin: Thought to have originated from the old proverb encouraging people to move on from minor mishaps.
holidays.funFact: Spilled milk has been the subject of many idioms, but no one actually cries over it on this day‚Äîjust laughs!

holidays.name: International Day of Women and Girls in Science
holidays.description: A UN observance celebrating the role of women and girls in science and technology fields.
holidays.origin: Established by the United Nations in 2015 to promote gender equality in STEM.
holidays.funFact: Despite growing participation, women still make up less than 30% of researchers worldwide‚Äîeven with this empowering day!

holidays.name: National Clean Out Your Refrigerator Day
holidays.description: An odd but strangely satisfying day encouraging people to clean and organize their fridges.
holidays.origin: Created by household tips enthusiasts and promoted on social media to encourage food safety and reduce waste.
holidays.funFact: Cleaning out your fridge can reduce food waste and even save money‚Äîplus the bonus of discovering expired mystery items!
